titleStmt.title: J. P. Hodges and F. M. Renfro to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2291

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Hardyville Hart Co Ky.
Novr 9th 1865.
Gov Thos E. Bramlett:
Honorable sir:
Whereas;

The troubles of the country has disbanded the most of the officers of our Town, and the few remaining, together with the citizens, wish to revive the town laws of this town, as an incorporate body, we would most respectfully petition your honor, to appoint as
Police Judge, Samuel Renfro and for a

Town Marshall, F, M, Kelley
and to fill vacancies of Trustees, John Renfro, A. G. Kelley and J, H, Biggs. If however, it should be the duty of the remaining Trustees to appoint new Trustees, please
inform us, and we will appoint them after we get a Judge and Marshall.

Very Respectfully
yours &c.
J. P. Hodges, Trustee.
F. M. Renfro "

Police Judge
Hardyville
Saml Renfro
apptd
13 Nov/65
